intro: Chorizanthe mieresii, commonly known as the Mieres' choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and spiny stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in gravelly soils and open habitats. Chorizanthe mieresii is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
